security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing no executable code, network calls, file system access, or environment variable reads. This skill consists entirely of documentation and prompt templates for structuring code review workflows.

content.user_title: Request code review for completed work
content.value_statement: Code quality issues compound over time. This skill provides a structured workflow to request code reviews after completing development tasks, catching bugs and improvements before they cascade into larger problems.
actual_capabilities: Generates git SHA references for commit ranges
Dispatches code-reviewer subagent for automated review
Categorizes issues by severity (Critical, Important, Minor)
Assesses production readiness with clear verdict
Provides checklist for code quality, architecture, and testing
limitations: Does not execute code or run tests directly
Requires git repository with commit history
Subagent must be available to perform actual review
Does not modify code or open pull requests

use_cases.title: Review after each task
use_cases.description: Catch issues immediately after completing development tasks rather than waiting for later review cycles

use_cases.title: Quality gate before merge
use_cases.description: Ensure all code meets quality standards before merging to main branch via structured review process

use_cases.title: Validate AI-generated code
use_cases.description: Review AI-generated implementations to verify they meet requirements and follow best practices

prompt_templates.title: Quick review request
prompt_templates.prompt: Request code review for my recent work. Base SHA: [git commit]. Head SHA: [current HEAD]. What was implemented: [brief description]. Requirements reference: [link to plan or requirements].

prompt_templates.title: Feature complete review
prompt_templates.scenario: Major feature finished, thorough check needed
prompt_templates.prompt: I just completed a major feature. Request comprehensive code review. Base SHA: [previous main]. Head SHA: [current]. Feature description: [what was built]. Full requirements: [spec document].

prompt_templates.title: Pre-merge validation
prompt_templates.scenario: Ready to merge, final quality check
prompt_templates.prompt: Request final code review before merging to main. Base SHA: [origin/main]. Head SHA: [current]. Description: [summary of all changes]. Assessment needed: production readiness, security concerns, and migration requirements.

prompt_templates.title: Refactoring baseline review
prompt_templates.prompt: Request code review before refactoring. Base SHA: [current HEAD]. Head SHA: [same as base - this is baseline]. Document current implementation strengths and weaknesses to establish refactoring baseline.

output_examples.input: Request code review for my authentication module. Base SHA: a7981ec. Head SHA: 3df7661. What was implemented: User login and session management with JWT tokens. Requirements: auth-spec.md in docs folder.
output: - Clean separation of concerns in auth module (auth.ts:15-45)
- Proper JWT token handling with expiration (token.ts:22-31)
- Good test coverage for login flow (auth.test.ts:8-67)
1. Missing rate limiting on login endpoint (auth.ts:89)
1. Error messages reveal whether user exists (auth.ts:95)
Impact: User enumeration risk in login form
**Reasoning:** Solid architecture with good security practices. Rate limiting should be added before production deployment.

best_practices: Review early and often rather than waiting for large PRs that are harder to change
Fix Critical and Important issues before proceeding to next task
Use specific git SHAs to ensure accurate diff review
anti_patterns: Skipping review because code seems simple
Ignoring Critical issues just to save time
Proceeding with unfixed Important issues that could cause problems

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude Code and Claude. Full functionality requires access to the code-reviewer subagent.

faq.question: How many changes can it review?
faq.answer: There is no hard limit. For very large PRs, consider splitting into smaller reviews by requesting review after each logical chunk.

faq.question: Can it integrate with GitHub or GitLab?
faq.answer: This skill generates review output. Integration with GitHub/GitLab requires additional setup to post results as comments.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-based skill. Code is only processed by your AI assistant and never sent to external services.

faq.question: What if the review finds no issues?
faq.answer: The reviewer will document strengths and confirm the implementation is ready to merge with clear reasoning.

faq.question: How does this compare to GitHub Copilot code review?
faq.answer: This skill provides a structured workflow with consistent output format. It focuses on process integration rather than just finding issues.
